table-wrap.anchoringText: Key wells in the study are shown in Figure 3 and summarised in Table 1. Two of these wells were drilled as unconventional tests of the Basin Centred Gas (BCG) concept with Washington-1 testing tight Permian sandstones and coals and Silver Star-1 testing tight Permian sandstones. Both wells were drilled outside of structural closure whereas Jute-1 was dilled inside closure. In the case of Washington-1 and Jute-1 fracture stimulation had variable results with frac gradients ranging from 0.9 to 1.2 psi/ft.
table-wrap.label: Table 1
table-wrap.caption: North Patchawarra Trough deep wells of interest within Permian Coal resource area

formatted-caption.caption-text: North Patchawarra Trough deep wells of interest within Permian Coal resource area

tr.td: Unconventional Patchawarra & Toolachee Coal and Sandstone
5 frac stages in coals and sandstones. Patchawarra coals thinly developed. 43 API oil recovered from isojars from Toolachee Fm. Coal.
5 Frac stages. Fluorescence throughout Permian sandstones. 30m of unconventional gas pay in Patchawarra sanstone.
Fluorescence/trace oil & 17m net tight gas pay in Permian sandstone. Mechanical difficulties - well plugged back to Toolachee Fm.
Conventional Jurassic, Patchawarra and Tirrawarra Sandstone
DST in upper Patchawarra Formation flowed 1.5 MMSCFD with trace condensate. Lower Patcahwarra tight.
Tight gas pay in Toolachee, Epsilon & Patchawarra Fm. DST in Toolachee flowed 4 MMSCFD. DST in Patchawarra Fm failed. Porosity <8%.
4.7m net pay oil in Poolowanna Fm. Permian section not logged or tested due to bore damage.
Tight gas sands in Patcahwarra Fm.DST failed due to mechanical difficulties.
Gas in Toolachee and Patchawarra Sandstones but DSTs failed due to tight conditions <10% porosity.

table-wrap.anchoringText: The model was initially constructed for expulsion and migration modelling (conventional hydrocarbon traps) and calibrated against observed fill-spill relationships, but as the model utilises Arco retention kinetics it can also be used for unconventional plays where retained free and adsorbed hydrocarbons for shale and coal units can also be calculated as explained in Cooper et al. (2015). Input variables, considered to be mid-range (P50), are shown in Table 2.
table-wrap.label: Table 2
table-wrap.caption: Trinity (Arco retention) model inputs (P50) for Cooper Basin Patchawarra Fm. Coal

formatted-caption.caption-text: Trinity (Arco retention) model inputs (P50) for Cooper Basin Patchawarra Fm. Coal
